product_requests.description: An AI coding assistant that can accurately debug complex code, provide step-by-step solutions, understand full codebase context, and avoid getting stuck or generating repetitive, unhelpful responses. It should be able to identify and address underlying problems, not just superficial symptoms.
product_requests.pain_point: Current AI coding assistants are often ineffective, get stuck, over-engineer, provide incorrect or repetitive solutions, and lack deep contextual understanding, leading to developer frustration and wasted time.

Address edge cases and potential failure points
Provide alternative approaches if applicable
STOP HERE and wait for my confirmation before proceeding
Step 6: Final Solution
Present the complete, integrated solution
Include all necessary code files and their content
Provide usage examples
Summarize the approach and highlight key decisions

product_requests.description: A platform for teams to create, manage, and share internal documentation that stays up-to-date. It should facilitate easy access to solutions for common problems and integrate with feature request/project management workflows, potentially using AI to flag or update outdated information.
product_requests.pain_point: Internal documentation is often outdated or non-existent, making it difficult for team members to find answers to common questions, leading to repeated inquiries and inefficient workflows.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Development Teams, Product Teams, IT Support, Employees in large organizations

friend: hey buddy how do i <do thing>, i can't find it in your team's docs and i feel super dumb

me: hey buddy! it doesn't exist. please re-ask this question in our public help channel so whoever is on-call can answer you.

friend: hi team, our service needs to <do thing> because of <legit reasons>. we're wondering what the right way to do it is. thanks!

me (also the on-call): hello, this is not possible at the moment, but we'll add a ticket for it and prioritize it in our upcoming sprint.

product_requests.description: A tool for entrepreneurs and product managers to quickly and effectively validate if a problem they experience is shared by a significant target audience, helping them decide if a product idea is worth pursuing. Could include survey templates, audience matching, and data analysis.
product_requests.pain_point: Entrepreneurs and product managers struggle to validate their product ideas and determine if a perceived problem is widespread enough to warrant building a solution, leading to wasted effort on unneeded products.
product_requests.target_audience: Entrepreneurs, Startup Founders, Product Managers, Innovators

product_requests.description: A project management system that offers highly granular and flexible dependency tracking, allowing users to define complex relationships between tasks (e.g., 'blocks,' 'depends on,' 'has to be done before/after/together with,' 'is subtask of,' 'has bug'). It should visualize these relationships clearly and help manage complex project workflows.
product_requests.pain_point: Existing project management tools lack the depth and flexibility to accurately represent and manage complex interdependencies between tasks, leading to project delays and miscommunications.
product_requests.target_audience: Project Managers, Software Development Teams, Engineering Teams, Complex Project Stakeholders

product_requests.description: A tool that automatically identifies code inefficiencies (e.g., O(N^2) functions), suggests refactoring for readability and modularity, and optimizes code for better performance and memory usage, adhering to best practices and specific language idioms (e.g., Java Optional chaining).
product_requests.pain_point: Developers struggle with manual code optimization, refactoring, and ensuring adherence to best practices, leading to less efficient, harder-to-maintain codebases and increased technical debt.
product_requests.target_audience: Software Developers, Code Reviewers, Engineering Leads

product_requests.description: A reliable and user-friendly utility that simplifies the installation, updating, and management of software, particularly for complex or 'repacked' applications, ensuring a smooth and error-free experience.
product_requests.pain_point: Users experience significant frustration and wasted time due to unreliable or complex software installations, especially with unofficial or 'repacked' versions, leading to broken software and system instability.
product_requests.target_audience: PC Users, Gamers, Developers, IT Support

product_requests.description: A modular hardware hub or system that provides a wide array of physical ports and universal connectivity options (e.g., advanced Bluetooth, swappable modules) to overcome the limitations of modern devices with minimal built-in ports.
product_requests.pain_point: Modern devices often lack sufficient physical ports and universal connectivity options, forcing users to rely on dongles or face compatibility issues, leading to frustration and limited functionality.
product_requests.target_audience: Tech Enthusiasts, Professionals with multiple peripherals, Mobile Device Users, Laptop Users

product_requests.description: A platform designed for technical users to ask and receive up-to-date, verified, and well-explained solutions to specific problems, avoiding the common issues of outdated or unresolved forum threads. It could incorporate expert verification or AI-driven summarization of best answers.
product_requests.pain_point: Existing online forums and Q&A sites often contain outdated, unverified, or incomplete solutions, making it difficult for users to find reliable answers to technical problems, leading to wasted time and continued frustration.
product_requests.target_audience: Developers, IT Professionals, Tech Enthusiasts, Students

product_requests.description: An application or service that helps individuals initiate and follow through on personal creative projects (e.g., writing, animating, game development) by providing structured goal setting, progress tracking, accountability features (e.g., gentle reminders, community support), and motivation prompts.
product_requests.pain_point: Individuals struggle with procrastination, lack of motivation, and difficulty maintaining momentum on personal creative projects, leading to unfinished work and unfulfilled creative aspirations.
product_requests.target_audience: Artists, Writers, Game Developers (indie), Animators, Hobbyists, Content Creators

product_requests.description: An interactive tool, possibly AI-powered, that guides users through a structured questioning process to help them articulate the true underlying problem (X) they are trying to solve, rather than just their attempted solution (Y). This would be particularly useful for technical support, debugging, or general problem-solving.
product_requests.pain_point: Users often misdiagnose their problems or ask for help with a perceived solution rather than the actual root cause, leading to inefficient troubleshooting, irrelevant advice, and prolonged frustration (the 'XY Problem').
product_requests.target_audience: Technical Support Agents, Developers, Anyone seeking help with complex problems, AI Assistant Developers (to integrate this logic)

tweets.text:
We often focus on the wrong problem when asking for help. Instead of asking about X, we end up asking about Y. Let me explain...

Say you're implementing image¬†upload in your service, and while doing so, you get stuck converting a base64 string into an image. So, you ask for help decoding base64.

But the real problem isn't decoding base64, it's actually handling image uploads. If you had asked about photo uploads, someone might have shown you an easier way to solve it all.

That's the classic XY problem: you ask about your assumed solution Y, instead of explaining the actual problem X you want to solve.

- say what you are really trying to do
- don't assume your solution is the only way
- explain the full problem, not just the code snippet
- describe what you have already tried

Before you ask, check yourself: are you asking about Y or explaining X? Don't get trapped by the XY problem, solve the right issue and not just your guess at it.

Asking the right question can only take you to the right answer.
